intro: Adenanthos dobagii, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is typically found in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
